name: Bullywug Bog Sage

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
traits.description: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The bullywug makes two Bog Staff attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast *Ray of Sickness*.

actions.name: Bog Staff
actions.description: *Melee Attack Roll:* +5, reach 5 ft. *Hit:* 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The bullywug casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks):

bonusActions.name: Leap
bonusActions.description: The bullywug jumps up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

lore:
*Amphibious Appreciators of Marsh and Muck*
**Habitat:** Swamp; **Treasure:** Implements, Individual
Fey embodiments of swamplands, bullywugs protect the murky wilds and consider themselves cosmically favored for that role. These human-size, toad- or frog-like creatures have close relationships with the creatures of the swamp.
Bullywug bog sages channel the magic of the swamp to sicken foes and speak with plants.
Bullywug warriors are adept at moving through swamps and ambushing trespassers. They often work alongside packs of trained giant frogs.
